channel.title: Fraps or DxTory
channel.description:
Hello moparscapers,
I have a question wich I do not have found a clear answer to. What do you think is the best for recording on your pc. Wich causes the lowest lag on your computer? Some say fraps is better some say dxtory. Please discuss.
thanks in advance, halflive9

item.title: Fraps or DxTory
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:5, topic:455808”][quote author=Niall link=topic=558723.msg4086318#msg4086318 date=1345895114]
fraps works well by not using any compression in real time so it saves raw footage, be prepared to have 30gb free space for a few minutes recording
[/quote]
Recorded a 5 and a half hour session of DayZ and had 246GB used. Fraps is good but just compress the files by rendering them in editing software. Sony Vegas being the easiest and probably the fastest.[/quote]I recommend VirtualDub. Sony Vegas is great for editing, especially performance-wise (it’s what I use to edit videos), but VirtualDub is the best when it comes to just rendering videos. It can even fix videos out of sync with the audio with just one click.

Read full topic

item.title: Fraps or DxTory
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Niall:

fraps works well by not using any compression in real time so it saves raw footage, be prepared to have 30gb free space for a few minutes recording

Recorded a 5 and a half hour session of DayZ and had 246GB used. Fraps is good but just compress the files by rendering them in editing software. Sony Vegas being the easiest and probably the fastest.

Read full topic

item.title: Fraps or DxTory
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Nothing will ever beat Fraps. It does use a very weak compression (in fact, it’s Fraps’s own), but the file sizes are still quite large. Nothing a quick recompress in VirtualDub can’t fix.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Fraps but be warned the files are large
